EZ - Z vs E made easy¶

A python module to load, fit and plot impedance spectroscopy data. The datasets contain the impedance evolution as a function of the frequency of a perturbation (e.g. potential or light bias), recorded at different applied potentials. This data can be fitted using a model equivalent circuit or a custom model equation.

  • EIS
    • Equivalent circuit definition
    • Loading and plotting the EIS data
    • Fitting and displaying fit results
  • IMPS
    • Model equation definition
    • Loading and plotting the IMPS data
    • Fitting and displaying fit results
  • Documentation
    • Loading data - data.py
    • Equivalent circuit - EC.py
    • Plotting - plot.py
    • Plotting - stderr.py

Installation¶

Using pip:

pip install echem-EZ

Or download the EZ folder on Github and add it to your python path.

Examples¶

  • EIS: Loading, plotting and fitting electrochemical impedance spectroscopy data using an equivalent circuit model.

  • IMPS: Loading, plotting and fitting intensity modulated photocurrent spectroscopy data using a model equation.

Dependencies¶

This code relies on the use of the scipy, numpy, pandas and matplotlib packages. It also uses the lmfit package (Matt Newville et al., LMFIT: Non-Linear Least-Square Minimization and Curve-Fitting for Python) and the SchemDraw package.
